intro: Houstonia purpurea var. montana, commonly known as mountain bluebells, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland habitats. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a soft, velvety texture.
